intro: Oxytropis asterocarpa, commonly known as the Sierra lupine, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as slopes and open woodlands. Its leaves are compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Oxytropis asterocarpa plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in its native range.
